nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_5.description: The information system protects against or limits the effects of the following types of denial of service attacks: [Assignment: organization-defined types of denial of service attacks or references to sources for such information] by employing [Assignment: organization-defined security safeguards].

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7_3.name: SC-7(3) Access Points
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7_3.description: The organization limits the number of external network connections to the information system.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7.name: Boundary Protection (SC-7)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7.description: The information system: a. Monitors and controls communications at the external boundary of the system and at key internal boundaries within the system; b. Implements subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are [Selection: physically; logically] separated from internal organizational networks; and c. Connects to external networks or information systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_8_1.name: SC-8(1) Cryptographic Or Alternate Physical Protection
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_8_1.description: The information system implements cryptographic mechanisms to [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] during transmission unless otherwise protected by [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical safeguards].

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_8.name: Transmission Confidentiality And Integrity (SC-8)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_8.description: The information system protects the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of transmitted information.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_12.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment And Management (SC-12)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_12.description: The organization establishes and manages cryptographic keys for required cryptography employed within the information system in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction].

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_13.name: Cryptographic Protection (SC-13)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_13.description: The information system implements [Assignment: organization-defined cryptographic uses and type of cryptography required for each use] in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_23.name: Session Authenticity (SC-23)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_23.description: The information system protects the authenticity of communications sessions.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_28.name: Protection Of Information At Rest (SC-28)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_sc_28.description: The information system protects the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of [Assignment: organization-defined information at rest].

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_2_2.name: SI-2(2) Automates Flaw Remediation Status
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_2_2.description: The organization employs automated mechanisms to determine the state of information system components with regard to flaw remediation.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_1.name: SI-4(1) System-Wide Intrusion Detection System
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_1.description: The organization connects and configures individual intrusion detection tools into an information system-wide intrusion detection system.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_2.name: SI-4(2) Automated Tools For Real-Time Analysis
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_2.description: The organization employs automated tools to support near real-time analysis of events.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_4.name: SI-4(4) Inbound and Outbound Communications Traffic
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_4.description: The information system monitors inbound and outbound communications traffic continuously for unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_5.name: SI-4(5) System-Generated Alerts
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_5.description: The information system alerts organization-defined personnel or roles when the following indications of compromise or potential compromise occur: [Assignment: organization-defined compromise indicators].

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_16.name: SI-4(16) Correlate Monitoring Information
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4_16.description: The organization correlates information from monitoring tools employed throughout the information system.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.name: Information System Monitoring (SI-4)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.description: The organization: a.Monitors the information system to detect: 1. Attacks and indicators of potential attacks in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined monitoring objectives]; and 2.Unauthorized local, network, and remote connections; b. Identifies unauthorized use of the information system through [Assignment: organization-defined techniques and methods]; c. Deploys monitoring devices: 1. Strategically within the information system to collect organization-determined essential information; and 2. At ad hoc locations within the system to track specific types of transactions of interest to the organization; d. Protects information obtained from intrusion-monitoring tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion; e. Heightens the level of information system monitoring activity whenever there is an indication of increased risk to organizational operations and assets, individuals, other organizations, or the Nation based on law enforcement information, intelligence information, or other credible sources of information; f. Obtains legal opinion with regard to information system monitoring activities in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, or regulations; and g. Provides [Assignment: organization-defined information system monitoring information] to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] [Selection (one or more): as needed; [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]].

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_7_1.name: SI-7(1) Integrity Checks
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_7_1.description: The information system performs an integrity check of security relevant events at least monthly.

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_7.name: Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity (SI-7)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_7.description: The organization employs integrity verification tools to detect unauthorized changes to [Assignment: organization-defined software, firmware, and information].

nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_12.name: Information Handling and Retention (SI-12)
nist_800_53_revision_4_gen_001_si_12.description: The organization handles and retains information within the information system and information output from the system in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and operational requirements.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_1.name: AC-2(1) Automated System Account Management
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_1.description: Support the management of system accounts using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3_a.name: AC-2(3)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3_a.description: Support the management of system accounts using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3_b.name: AC-2(3)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3_b.description: Disable accounts within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the accounts: (b) Are no longer associated with a user or individual.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3_c.name: AC-2(3)(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3_c.description: Disable accounts within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the accounts: (c) Are in violation of organizational policy.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3_d.name: AC-2(3)(d)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3_d.description: Disable accounts within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the accounts: (d) Have been inactive for [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3.name: AC-2(3) Disable Accounts
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_3.description: Disable accounts within [Assignment: organization-defined time period] when the accounts: (a) Have expired; (b) Are no longer associated with a user or individual; (c) Are in violation of organizational policy; or (d) Have been inactive for [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_4.name: AC-2(4) Automated Audit Actions
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_4.description: Automatically audit account creation, modification, enabling, disabling, and removal actions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_6.name: AC-2(6) Dynamic Privilege Management
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_6.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined dynamic privilege management capabilities].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_12_a.name: AC-2(12)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_12_a.description: Monitor system accounts for [Assignment: organization-defined atypical usage].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_d_1.name: AC-2(d)(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_d_1.description: d. Specify: 1. Authorized users of the system;personnel termination and transfer processes.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_g.name: AC-2(g)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_g.description: The organization: g. Monitors the use of information system accounts.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_i_2.name: AC-2(i)(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_i_2.description: i. Authorize access to the system based on: 2. Intended system usage.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_j.name: AC-2(j)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_2_j.description: The organization: j. Reviews accounts for compliance with account management requirements [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3.name: Access Enforcement (AC-3)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3.description: Enforce approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_1.name: AC-3(1) Restricted Access To Privileged Functions
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_1.description: Employ an audited override of automated access control mechanisms under [Assignment: organization-defined conditions] by [Assignment: organization-defined roles].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_2.name: AC-3(2) Dual Authorization
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_2.description: Enforce dual authorization for [Assignment: organization-defined privileged commands and/or other organization-defined actions].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3.name: AC-3(3) Mandatory Access Control
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access control policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (a) Is uniformly enforced across the covered subjects and objects within the system; (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (1) Passing the information to unauthorized subjects or objects; (2) Granting its privileges to other subjects; (3) Changing one or more security attributes (specified by the policy) on subjects, objects, the system, or system components; (4) Choosing the security attributes and attribute values (specified by the policy) to be associated with newly created or modified objects; and (5) Changing the rules governing access control; and (c) Specifies that [Assignment: organization-defined subjects] may explicitly be granted [Assignment: organization-defined privileges] such that they are not limited by any defined subset (or all) of the above constraints.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_a.name: AC-3(3)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_a.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (a) Is uniformly enforced across the covered subjects and objects within the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.name: AC-3(3)(b)(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (1) Passing the information to unauthorized subjects or objects.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.name: AC-3(3)(b)(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (2) Granting its privileges to other subjects.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.name: AC-3(3)(b)(3)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (3) Changing one or more security attributes (specified by the policy) on subjects, objects, the system, or system components.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.name: AC-3(3)(b)(4)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (4) Choosing the security attributes and attribute values (specified by the policy) to be associated with newly created or modified objects.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.name: AC-3(3)(b)(5)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_b_.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (b) Specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information is constrained from doing any of the following; (5) Changing the rules governing access.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_c.name: AC-3(3)(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_3_c.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy: (c) Specifies that [Assignment: organization-defined subjects] may explicitly be granted [Assignment: organization-defined privileges] such that they are not limited by any defined subset (or all) of the above constraints.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4.name: AC-3(4) Discretionary Access Control
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access control policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (a) Pass the information to any other subjects or objects; (b) Grant its privileges to other subjects; (c) Change security attributes on subjects, objects, the system, or the system’s components; (d) Choose the security attributes to be associated with newly created or revised objects; or (e) Change the rules governing access control.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_a.name: AC-3(4)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_a.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (a) Pass the information to any other subjects or objects.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_b.name: AC-3(4)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_b.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (b) Grant its privileges to other subjects.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_c.name: AC-3(4)(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_c.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (c) Change security attributes on subjects, objects, the system, or the system’s components.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_d.name: AC-3(4)(d)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_d.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (d) Choose the security attributes to be associated with newly created or revised objects.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_e.name: AC-3(4)(e)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_4_e.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy, and where the policy specifies that a subject that has been granted access to information can do one or more of the following: (e) Change the rules governing access.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_7.name: AC-3(7) Role-Based Access Control
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_7.description: Enforce a role-based access control policy over defined subjects and objects and control access based upon [Assignment: organization-defined roles and users authorized to assume such roles].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_8.name: AC-3(8) Revocation Of Access Authorizations
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_8.description: Enforce the revocation of access authorizations resulting from changes to the security attributes of subjects and objects based on [Assignment: organization-defined rules governing the timing of revocations of access authorizations].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_10.name: AC-3(10) Audited Override Of Access Control Mechanisms
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_10.description: Employ an audited override of automated access mechanisms under [Assignment: organization-defined conditions] by [Assignment: organization-defined roles].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_12_a.name: AC-3(12)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_12_a.description: Require applications to assert, as part of the installation process, the access needed to the following system applications and functions: [Assignment: organization-defined system applications and functions].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_12_b.name: AC-3(12)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_12_b.description: Provide an enforcement mechanism to prevent unauthorized access;

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_13.name: AC-3(13) Attribute-Based Access Control
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_13.description: Enforce attribute-based access control policy over defined subjects and objects and control access based upon [Assignment: organization-defined attributes to assume access permissions].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_15_a.name: AC-3(15)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_15_a.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined mandatory access control policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_15_b.name: AC-3(15)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_3_15_b.description: Enforce [Assignment: organization-defined discretionary access control policy] over the set of covered subjects and objects specified in the policy.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4.name: Information Flow Enforcement (AC-4)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4.description: Enforce approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between connected systems based on [Assignment: organization-defined information flow control policies].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4_21.name: AC-4(21) Physical Or Logical Separation Of Infomation Flows
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4_21.description: Separate information flows logically or physically using [Assignment: organization-defined mechanisms and/or techniques] to accomplish [Assignment: organization-defined required separations by types of information].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4_22.name: AC-4(22) Access Only
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4_22.description: Provide access from a single device to computing platforms, applications, or data residing in multiple different security domains, while preventing information flow between the different security domains.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4_26.name: AC-4(26) Audit Filtering Actions
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4_26.description: When transferring information between different security domains, record and audit content filtering actions and results for the information being filtered.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4_28.name: AC-4(28) Linear Filter Pipelines
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_4_28.description: When transferring information between different security domains, implement a linear content filter pipeline that is enforced with discretionary and mandatory access controls.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_5_b.name: AC-5(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_5_b.description: Define system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6.name: Least Privilege (AC-6)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6.description: Employ the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) that are necessary to accomplish assigned organizational tasks.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6_2.name: AC-6(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6_2.description: Require that users of system accounts (or roles) with access to [Assignment: organization-defined security functions or security-relevant information] use non-privileged accounts or roles, when accessing nonsecurity functions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6_3.name: AC-6(3)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6_3.description: Authorize network access to [Assignment: organization-defined privileged commands] only for [Assignment: organization-defined compelling operational needs] and document the rationale for such access in the security plan for the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6_9.name: AC-6(9)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6_9.description: Log the execution of privileged functions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6_10.name: AC-6(10)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_6_10.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_7_4.name: AC-7(4) Use Of Alternate Authentication Factor
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_7_4.description: Prevent non-privileged users from executing privileged functions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_7_4_a.name: AC-7(4)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_7_4_a.description: Allow the use of [Assignment: organization-defined authentication factors] that are different from the primary authentication factors after the number of organization-defined consecutive invalid logon attempts have been exceeded.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_16_b.name: AC-16(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_16_b.description: Ensure that the attribute associations are made and retained with the information.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_b.name: AC-17(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_b.description: Authorize each type of remote access to the system prior to allowing such connections.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_1.name: AC-17(1) Monitoring And Control
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_1.description: Employ automated mechanisms to monitor and control remote access methods.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_2.name: AC-17(2) Protection Of Confidentiality And Integrity Using Encryption
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_2.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_4_a.name: AC-17(4)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_4_a.description: Authorize the execution of privileged commands and access to security-relevant information via remote access only in a format that provides assessable evidence and for the following needs: [Assignment: organization-defined needs];

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_9.name: AC-17(9) Disconnect Or Disable Access
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_9.description: Provide the capability to disconnect or disable remote access to the system within [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_10.name: AC-17(10) Authenticate Remote Commands
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_17_10.description: Provide the capability to disconnect or disable remote access to the system within [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_24.name: Access Control Decisions (AC-24)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_24.description: [Selection: Establish procedures; Implement mechanisms] to ensure [Assignment: organization-defined access control decisions] are applied to each access request prior to access enforcement.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_24_1.name: AC-24(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ac_24_1.description: Transmit [Assignment: organization-defined access authorization information] using [Assignment: organization-defined controls] to [Assignment: organization-defined systems] that enforce access control decisions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_2_b.name: AU-2(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_2_b.description: Coordinate the event logging function with other organizational entities requiring audit-related information to guide and inform the selection criteria for events to be logged.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_1.name: AU-3(1) Additional Audit Information
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_1.description: Generate audit records containing the following additional information: [Assignment: organization-defined additional information].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_a.name: AU-3(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_a.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: a. What type of event occurred.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_b.name: AU-3(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_b.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: b. When the event occurred.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_c.name: AU-3(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_c.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: c. Where the event occurred.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_d.name: AU-3(d)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_d.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: d. Source of the event.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_e.name: AU-3(e)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_e.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: e. Outcome of the event.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_f.name: AU-3(f)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_3_f.description: Ensure that audit records contain information that establishes the following: e. Outcome of the event.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_4_1.name: AU-4(1) Transfer To Alternate Storage
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_4_1.description: Transfer audit logs [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to a different system, system component, or media other than the system or system component conducting the logging.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_1.name: AU-6(1) Automated Process Integration
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_1.description: Integrate audit record review, analysis, and reporting processes using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_3.name: AU-6(3) Correlate Audit Record Repositories
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_3.description: Analyze and correlate audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_4.name: AU-6(4) Central Review And Analysis
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_4.description: Provide and implement the capability to centrally review and analyze audit records from multiple components within the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_5.name: AU-6(5) Central Review And Analysis
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_5.description: Integrate analysis of audit records with analysis of [Selection (one or more): vulnerability scanning information; performance data; system monitoring information; [Assignment: organization-defined data/information collected from other sources]] to further enhance the ability to identify inappropriate or unusual activity.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_6.name: AU-6(6) Correletion With Physical Monitoring
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_6.description: Correlate information from audit records with information obtained from monitoring physical access to further enhance the ability to identify suspicious, inappropriate, unusual, or malevolent activity.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_9.name: AU-6(9) Correletion With From Nontechnical Sources
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_6_9.description: Correlate information from nontechnical sources with audit record information to enhance organization-wide situational awareness.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_7_1.name: AU-7(1) Automatic Processing
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_7_1.description: Provide and implement the capability to process, sort, and search audit records for events of interest based on the following content: [Assignment: organization-defined fields within audit records].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_8_b.name: AU-8(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_8_b.description: Record time stamps for audit records that meet [Assignment: organization-defined granularity of time measurement] and that use Coordinated Universal Time, have a fixed local time offset from Coordinated Universal Time, or that include the local time offset as part of the time stamp.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_9_a.name: AU-9(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_9_a.description: Protect audit information and audit logging tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_9_2.name: AU-9(2) Store On Separate Physical Systems Or Components
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_9_2.description: Store audit records [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] in a repository that is part of a physically different system or system component than the system or component being audited.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_9_3.name: AU-9(3) Cryptographic Protection
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_9_3.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect the integrity of audit information and audit tools.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_9_7.name: AU-9(7) Store On Component With Different Operation Systems
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_9_7.description: Store audit information on a component running a different operating system than the system or component being audited.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_10.name: Non-Repudiation (AU-10)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_10.description: Provide irrefutable evidence that an individual (or process acting on behalf of an individual) has performed [Assignment: organization-defined actions to be covered by non-repudiation].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_11.name: Audit Record Retention (AU-11)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_11.description: Retain audit records for [Assignment: organization-defined time period consistent with records retention policy] to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_11_1.name: AU-11(1) Long-Term Retrieval Capability
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_11_1.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined measures] to ensure that long-term audit records generated by the system can be retrieved.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_a.name: AU-12(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_a.description: Provide audit record generation capability for the event types the system is capable of auditing as defined in AU-2a on [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_c.name: AU-12(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_c.description: Generate audit records for the event types defined in AU-2c that include the audit record content defined in AU-3.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_1.name: AU-12(1) System-Wide And Time-Correlated Audit Trial
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_1.description: Compile audit records from [Assignment: organization-defined system components] into a system-wide (logical or physical) audit trail that is time-correlated to within [Assignment: organization-defined level of tolerance for the relationship between time stamps of individual records in the audit trail].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_2.name: AU-12(2) Standardized Formats
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_2.description: Produce a system-wide (logical or physical) audit trail composed of audit records in a standardized format.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_3.name: AU-12(3) Changes By Authorized Individuals
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_3.description: Provide and implement the capability for [Assignment: organization-defined individuals or roles] to change the logging to be performed on [Assignment: organization-defined system components] based on [Assignment: organization-defined selectable event criteria] within [Assignment: organization-defined time thresholds].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_4.name: AU-12(4) Query Parameter Audits Of Personally Identifiable Information
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_12_4.description: Provide and implement the capability for auditing the parameters of user query events for data sets containing personally identifiable information.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_14_a.name: AU-14(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_14_a.description: Provide and implement the capability for [Assignment: organization-defined users or roles] to [Selection (one or more): record; view; hear; log] the content of a user session under [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_14_b.name: AU-14(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_14_b.description: Develop, integrate, and use session auditing activities in consultation with legal counsel and in accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_14_3.name: AU-14(3) Remote Viewing And Listening
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_14_3.description: Provide and implement the capability for authorized users to remotely view and hear content related to an established user session in real time.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_16.name: Cross-Organizational Audit Logging (AU-16)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_au_16.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined methods] for coordinating [Assignment: organization-defined audit information] among external organizations when audit information is transmitted across organizational boundaries.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_2_2.name: CA-2(2) Specialized Assessments
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_2_2.description: Include as part of control assessments, [Assignment: organization-defined frequency], [Selection: announced; unannounced], [Selection (one or more): in-depth monitoring; security instrumentation; automated security test cases; vulnerability scanning; malicious user testing; insider threat assessment; performance and load testing; data leakage or data loss assessment; [Assignment: organization-defined other forms of assessment]].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_2_d.name: CA-2(d)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_2_d.description: Assess the controls in the system and its environment of operation [Assignment: organization-defined frequency] to determine the extent to which the controls are implemented correctly, operating as intended, and producing the desired outcome with respect to meeting established security and privacy requirements.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_7.name: Continuous Monitoring (CA-7)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_7.description: Continuously monitor configuration management processes. Determine security impact, environment and operational risks.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_7_b.name: CA-7(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_7_b.description: Develop a system-level continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring in accordance with the organization-level continuous monitoring strategy that includes: b. Establishing [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for monitoring and [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for assessment of control effectiveness.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_7_4_c.name: CA-7(4)(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_7_4_c.description: Ensure risk monitoring is an integral part of the continuous monitoring strategy that includes the following: (c) Change monitoring.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_9_b.name: CA-9(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ca_9_b.description: Document, for each internal connection, the interface characteristics, security and privacy requirements, and the nature of the information communicated.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_a.name: CM-2(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_a.description: Develop, document, and maintain under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_b.name: CM-2(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_b.description: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system: 1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]; 2. When required due to [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances]; and 3. When system components are installed or upgraded.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_b_1.name: CM-2(b)(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_b_1.description: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system: 1. [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_b_2.name: CM-2(b)(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_b_2.description: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system: 2. When required due to [Assignment: organization-defined circumstances].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_b_3.name: CM-2(b)(3)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_b_3.description: Review and update the baseline configuration of the system: 3 When system components are installed or upgraded.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_2.name: CM-2(2) Automation Support For Accuracy And Currency
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_2_2.description: Maintain the currency, completeness, accuracy, and availability of the baseline configuration of the system using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_3_3.name: CM-3(3) Automated Change Implementation
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_3_3.description: Implement changes to the current system baseline and deploy the updated baseline across the installed base using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_3_a.name: CM-3(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_3_a.description: Determine and document the types of changes to the system that are configuration-controlled.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_5_1_a.name: CM-5(1)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_5_1_a.description: Enforce access restrictions using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_5_1_b.name: CM-5(1)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_5_1_b.description: Automatically generate audit records of the enforcement actions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_6.name: Configuration Settings (CM-6)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_6.description: The organization: (i) establishes mandatory configuration settings for information technology products employed within the information system; (ii) configures the security settings of information technology products to the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements; (iii) documents the configuration settings; and (iv) enforces the configuration settings in all components of the information system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_6_a.name: CM-6(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_6_a.description: Establish and document configuration settings for components employed within the system that reflect the most restrictive mode consistent with operational requirements using [Assignment: organization-defined common secure configurations].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_7_b.name: CM-7(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_7_b.description: Prohibit or restrict the use of the following functions, ports, protocols, software, and/or services: [Assignment: organization-defined prohibited or restricted functions, system ports, protocols, software, and/or services].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_1.name: CM-8(1) Updates During Installation And Removals
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_1.description: Update the inventory of system components as part of component installations, removals, and system updates.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_2.name: CM-8(2) Automated Maintenance
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_2.description: Maintain the currency, completeness, accuracy, and availability of the inventory of system components using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_3_a.name: CM-8(3)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_3_a.description: Detect the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components within the system using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_6.name: CM-8(6) Assessed Configurations And Approved Deviations
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_6.description: Include assessed component configurations and any approved deviations to current deployed configurations in the system component inventory.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a.name: CM-8(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 1. Accurately reflects the system; 2. Includes all components within the system; 3. Does not include duplicate accounting of components or components assigned to any other system; 4. Is at the level of granularity deemed necessary for tracking and reporting; and 5. Includes the following information to achieve system component accountability: [Assignment: organization-defined information deemed necessary to achieve effective system component accountability].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_1.name: CM-8(a)(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_1.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 1. Accurately reflects the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_2.name: CM-8(a)(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_2.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 2. Includes all components within the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_3.name: CM-8(a)(3)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_3.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 3. Does not include duplicate accounting of components or components assigned to any other system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_4.name: CM-8(a)(4)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_4.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 4. Is at the level of granularity deemed necessary for tracking and reporting.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_5.name: CM-8(a)(5)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_a_5.description: Develop and document an inventory of system components that: 5. Includes the following information to achieve system component accountability: [Assignment: organization-defined information deemed necessary to achieve effective system component accountability].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_b.name: CM-8(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_8_b.description: Review and update the system component inventory [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_9_b.name: CM-9(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_9_b.description: Develop, document, and implement a configuration management plan for the system that: b. Establishes a process for identifying configuration items throughout the system development life cycle and for managing the configuration of the configuration items.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_12_b.name: CM-12(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cm_12_b.description: Identify and document the users who have access to the system and system components where the information is processed and stored.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_1_a_1_.name: CP-1(a)(1)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_1_a_1_.description: a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]: 1. [Selection (one or more): Organization-level; Mission/business process-level; System-level] contingency planning policy that: (b) Is consistent with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, and guidelines.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_1_a_2.name: CP-1(a)(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_1_a_2.description: a. Develop, document, and disseminate to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]: 2. Procedures to facilitate the implementation of the contingency planning policy and the associated contingency planning controls.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_1_2.name: CP-1(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_1_2.description: Implement transaction recovery for systems that are transaction-based.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_a.name: CP-2(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_a.description: a. Develop a contingency plan for the system that: 1. Identifies essential mission and business functions and associated contingency requirements; 2. Provides recovery objectives, restoration priorities, and metrics; 3. Addresses contingency roles, responsibilities, assigned individuals with contact information; 4. Addresses maintaining essential mission and business functions despite a system disruption, compromise, or failure; 5. Addresses eventual, full system restoration without deterioration of the controls originally planned and implemented; 6. Addresses the sharing of contingency information; and 7. Is reviewed and approved by [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles]

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_a_6.name: CP-2(a)(6)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_a_6.description: Develop a contingency plan for the system that: 6. Addresses the sharing of contingency information.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_a_7.name: CP-2(a)(7)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_a_7.description: Develop a contingency plan for the system that: 7. Is reviewed and approved by [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_d.name: CP-2(d)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_d.description: Review the contingency plan for the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency]

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_e.name: CP-2(e)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_e.description: Update the contingency plan to address changes to the organization, system, or environment of operation and problems encountered during contingency plan implementation, execution, or testing.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_5.name: CP-2(5) Continue Mission And Business Functions
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_5.description: Plan for the continuance of [Selection: all; essential] mission and business functions with minimal or no loss of operational continuity and sustains that continuity until full system restoration at primary processing and/or storage sites.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_6.name: CP-2(6) Alternate Processing And Storage Sites
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_2_6.description: Plan for the transfer of [Selection: all; essential] mission and business functions to alternate processing and/or storage sites with minimal or no loss of operational continuity and sustain that continuity through system restoration to primary processing and/or storage sites.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_6_a.name: CP-6(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_6_a.description: Establish an alternate storage site, including necessary agreements to permit the storage and retrieval of system backup information.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_6_1.name: CP-6(1) Separation From Primary Site
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_6_1.description: Identify an alternate storage site that is sufficiently separated from the primary storage site to reduce susceptibility to the same threats.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_6_2.name: CP-6(2) Recovery Time And Recovery Point Objectives
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_6_2.description: Configure the alternate storage site to facilitate recovery operations in accordance with recovery time and recovery point objectives.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_a.name: CP-9(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_a.description: Conduct backups of user-level information contained in [Assignment: organization-defined system components] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_b.name: CP-9(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_b.description: Conduct backups of system-level information contained in the system [Assignment: organization-defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_c.name: CP-9(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_c.description: Conduct backups of system documentation, including security- and privacy-related documentation [Assignment: organization-defined frequency consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_d.name: CP-9(d)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_d.description: Protect the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of backup information.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_8.name: CP-9(8) Cryptographic Protection
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_9_8.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to prevent unauthorized disclosure and modification of [Assignment: organization-defined backup information].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_10.name: System Recovery And Reconstitution (CP-10)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_10.description: Provide for the recovery and reconstitution of the system to a known state within [Assignment: organization-defined time period consistent with recovery time and recovery point objectives] after a disruption, compromise, or failure.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_10_2.name: CP-10(2) Transaction Recovery
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_cp_10_2.description: Implement transaction recovery for systems that are transaction-based.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2.name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational users) (IA-2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2.description: The information system uniquely identifies and authenticates organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of organizational users).

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_1.name: IA-2(1) Multi-Factor Authentication To Privileged Accounts
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_1.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to privileged accounts.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_2.name: IA-2(2) Multi-Factor Authentication To Non-Privileged Accounts
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_2.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for access to non-privileged accounts.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_6.name: IA-2(6) Acces To Accounts — Separate Device
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_6.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for [Selection (one or more): local; network; remote] access to [Selection (one or more): privileged accounts; non-privileged accounts] such that: (a) One of the factors is provided by a device separate from the system gaining access; and (b) The device meets [Assignment: organization-defined strength of mechanism requirements].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_6_a.name: IA-2(6)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_6_a.description: Implement multi-factor authentication for [Selection (one or more): local; network; remote] access to [Selection (one or more): privileged accounts; non-privileged accounts] such that: (a) One of the factors is provided by a device separate from the system gaining access.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_8.name: IA-2(8) Access To Accounts — Replay Resistant
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_2_8.description: Implement replay-resistant authentication mechanisms for access to [Selection (one or more): privileged accounts; non-privileged accounts].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_3_3_b.name: IA-3(3)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_3_3_b.description: Audit lease information when assigned to a device.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_4_b.name: IA-4(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_4_b.description: Manage system identifiers by: b. Selecting an identifier that identifies an individual, group, role, service, or device.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_4_d.name: IA-4(d)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_4_d.description: Manage system identifiers by: d. Preventing reuse of identifiers for [Assignment: organization-defined time period].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_4_4.name: IA-4(4)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_4_4.description: Manage individual identifiers by uniquely identifying each individual as [Assignment: organization-defined characteristic identifying individual status].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5.name: Authenticator Management (IA-5)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5.description: Authenticate users and devices. Automate administrative control. Enforce restrictions. Protect against unauthorized use.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_b.name: IA-5(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_b.description: Manage system authenticators by: b. Establishing initial authenticator content for any authenticators issued by the organization.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_c.name: IA-5(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_c.description: Manage system authenticators by: c. Ensuring that authenticators have sufficient strength of mechanism for their intended use.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_d.name: IA-5(d)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_d.description: Manage system authenticators by: d. Establishing and implementing administrative procedures for initial authenticator distribution, for lost or compromised or damaged authenticators, and for revoking authenticators.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_f.name: IA-5(f)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_f.description: Manage system authenticators by: f. Changing or refreshing authenticators [Assignment: organization-defined time period by authenticator type] or when [Assignment: organization-defined events] occur.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_h.name: IA-5(h)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_h.description: Manage system authenticators by: h. Requiring individuals to take, and having devices implement, specific controls to protect authenticators.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_1_c.name: IA-5(1)(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_1_c.description: For password-based authentication: (c) Transmit passwords only over cryptographically-protected channels.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_1_f.name: IA-5(1)(f)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_1_f.description: For password-based authentication: (f) Allow user selection of long passwords and passphrases, including spaces and all printable characters.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_1_g.name: IA-5(1)(g)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_1_g.description: For password-based authentication: (g) Employ automated tools to assist the user in selecting strong password authenticators.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_1_h.name: IA-5(1)(h)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_1_h.description: For password-based authentication: (h) Enforce the following composition and complexity rules: [Assignment: organization-defined composition and complexity rules].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_8.name: IA-5(8) Multiple System Accounts
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_8.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined security controls] to manage the risk of compromise due to individuals having accounts on multiple systems.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_18_a.name: IA-5(18)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_18_a.description: Employ [Assignment: organization-defined password managers] to generate and manage passwords.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_18_b.name: IA-5(18)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_5_18_b.description: Protect the passwords using [Assignment: organization-defined controls].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_8_2_b.name: IA-8(2)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ia_8_2_b.description: Document and maintain a list of accepted external authenticators.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ir_4_a.name: IR-4(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ir_4_a.description: Implement an incident handling capability for incidents that is consistent with the incident response plan and includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ma_4_c.name: MA-4(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ma_4_c.description: Employ strong authentication in the establishment of nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ma_4_1_a.name: MA-4(1)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ma_4_1_a.description: Log [Assignment: organization-defined audit events] for nonlocal maintenance and diagnostic sessions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_mp_2.name: Media Access (MP-2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_mp_2.description: Restrict access to [Assignment: organization-defined types of digital and/or non-digital media] to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pe_6_2.name: PE-6(2) Monitoring Physical Access
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pe_6_2.description: Recognize [Assignment: organization-defined classes or types of intrusions] and initiate [Assignment: organization-defined response actions] using [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pe_6_4.name: PE-6(4) Monitoring Physical Access
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pe_6_4.description: Monitor physical access to the system in addition to the physical access monitoring of the facility at [Assignment: organization-defined physical spaces containing one or more components of the system].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_11_b.name: PM-11(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_11_b.description: Determine information protection and personally identifiable information processing needs arising from the defined mission and business processes.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_14_a_1.name: PM-14(a)(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_14_a_1.description: a. Implement a process for ensuring that organizational plans for conducting security and privacy testing, training, and monitoring activities associated with organizational systems: 1. Are developed and maintained.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_14_b.name: PM-14(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_14_b.description: Review testing, training, and monitoring plans for consistency with the organizational risk management strategy and organization-wide priorities for risk response actions.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_16.name: Threat Awareness Program (PM-16)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_16.description: Implement a threat awareness program that includes a cross-organization information-sharing capability for threat intelligence.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_17_b.name: PM-17(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_17_b.description: Review and update the policy and procedures [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_21_b.name: PM-21(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_21_b.description: Retain the accounting of disclosures for the length of the time the personally identifiable information is maintained or five years after the disclosure is made, whichever is longer.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_31.name: Continuous Monitoring Strategy (PM-31)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_pm_31.description: Develop an organization-wide continuous monitoring strategy and implement continuous monitoring programs that include: a. Establishing the following organization-wide metrics to be monitored: [Assignment: organization-defined metrics]; b. Establishing [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for monitoring and [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for assessment of control effectiveness; c. Ongoing monitoring of organizationally-defined metrics in accordance with the continuous monitoring strategy; d. Correlation and analysis of information generated by control assessments and monitoring; e. Response actions to address results of the analysis of control assessment and monitoring information; and f. Reporting the security and privacy status of organizational systems to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles] [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_1_a.name: RA-1(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_1_a.description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 1. Search for indicators of compromise in organizational systems; and 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existing controls.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_1_a_1.name: RA-1(a)(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_1_a_1.description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 1. Search for indicators of compromise in organizational systems.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_1_a_2.name: RA-1(a)(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_1_a_2.description: a. Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existing controls.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_3_4.name: RA-3(4) Predictive Cyber Analytics
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_3_4.description: Employ the following advanced automation and analytics capabilities to predict and identify risks to [Assignment: organization-defined systems or system components]: [Assignment: organization-defined advanced automation and analytics capabilities].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_3_a_1.name: RA-3(a)(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_3_a_1.description: a. Conduct a risk assessment, including: 1. Identifying threats to and vulnerabilities in the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_5_a.name: RA-5(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_5_a.description: Monitor and scan for vulnerabilities in the system and hosted applications [Assignment: organization-defined frequency and/or randomly in accordance with organization-defined process] and when new vulnerabilities potentially affecting the system are identified and reported.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_5_4.name: RA-5(4) Discoverable Information
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_5_4.description: Determine information about the system that is discoverable and take [Assignment: organization-defined corrective actions].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_10_a.name: RA-10(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_10_a.description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 1. Search for indicators of compromise in organizational systems; and 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existings.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_10_a_1.name: RA-10(a)(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_10_a_1.description: Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 1. Search for indicators of compromise in organizational systems; and 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existings.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_10_a_2.name: RA-10(a)(2)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_ra_10_a_2.description: a. Establish and maintain a cyber threat hunting capability to: 2. Detect, track, and disrupt threats that evade existings.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sa_1_1.name: SA-1(1)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sa_1_1.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to enable integrity verification of software and firmware components.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sa_9_6.name: SA-9(6) Organization-Controlled Cryptographic Keys
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sa_9_6.description: Maintain exclusive control of cryptographic keys for encrypted material stored or transmitted through an external system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sa_10_1.name: SA-10(1) Software And Firmware Integrity Verification
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sa_10_1.description: Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to enable integrity verification of software and firmware components.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sa_15_a_4.name: SA-15(a)(4)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sa_15_a_4.description: a. Require the developer of the system, system component, or system service to follow a documented development process that: 4. Documents, manages, and ensures the integrity of changes to the process and/or tools used in development.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_1.name: SC-5(1) Restrict Ability TO Attack Other Systems
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_1.description: Restrict the ability of individuals to launch the following denial-of-service attacks against other systems: [Assignment: organization-defined denial-of-service attacks].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_2.name: SC-5(2) Capacity, Bandwidth, And Redundancy
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_2.description: Manage capacity, bandwidth, or other redundancy to limit the effects of information flooding denial-of-service attacks.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_3_a.name: SC-5(3)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_3_a.description: Employ the following monitoring tools to detect indicators of denial-of-service attacks against, or launched from, the system: [Assignment: organization-defined monitoring tools].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_3_b.name: SC-5(3)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_3_b.description: Monitor the following system resources to determine if sufficient resources exist to prevent effective denial-of-service attacks: [Assignment: organization-defined system resources].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_a.name: SC-5(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_a.description: [Selection: Protect against; Limit] the effects of the following types of denial-of-service events: [Assignment: organization-defined types of denial-of-service events].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_b.name: SC-5(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_5_b.description: Employ the following controls to achieve the denial-of-service objective: [Assignment: organization-defined controls by type of denial-of-service event].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_6.name: Resource Availability (SC-6)

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_2.name: SC-7(2) Public Access

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_3.name: SC-7(3) Access Points

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_4_b.name: SC-7(4)(b)

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_4_g.name: SC-7(4)(g)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_4_g.description: Publish information to enable remote networks to detect unauthorized control plane traffic from internal networks.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_5.name: SC-7(5) Deny By Default — Allow By Exception
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_5.description: Deny network communications traffic by default and allow network communications traffic by exception [Selection (one or more): at managed interfaces; for [Assignment: organization-defined systems]].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_7.name: SC-7(7) Split Tunneling For Remote Devices
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_7.description: Prevent split tunneling for remote devices connecting to organizational systems unless the split tunnel is securely provisioned using [Assignment: organization-defined safeguards].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_9_a.name: SC-7(9)(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_9_a.description: Detect and deny outgoing communications traffic posing a threat to external systems.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_9_b.name: SC-7(9)(b)

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_11.name: SC-7(11) Restrict Incoming communications Traffic
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_11.description: Only allow incoming communications from [Assignment: organization-defined authorized sources] to be routed to [Assignment: organization-defined authorized destinations].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_12.name: SC-7(12) Host-Based Protection
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_12.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined host-based boundary protection mechanisms] at [Assignment: organization-defined system components].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_16.name: SC-7(16) Prevent Discovery Of System Components
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_16.description: Prevent the discovery of specific system components that represent a managed interface.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_20.name: SC-7(20) Prevent Discovery Of System Components
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_20.description: Prevent the discovery of specific system components that represent a managed interface.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_21.name: SC-7(21) Isolation Of System Components
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_21.description: Employ boundary protection mechanisms to isolate [Assignment: organization-defined system components] supporting [Assignment: organization-defined missions and/or business functions].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_24_b.name: SC-7(24)(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_24_b.description: For systems that process personally identifiable information: (b) Monitor for permitted processing at the external interfaces to the system and at key internal boundaries within the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_25.name: SC-7(25) Unclassified National Security System Connections
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_25.description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined unclassified national security system] to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_26.name: SC-7(26) Classified National Security System Connections
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_26.description: Prohibit the direct connection of a classified national security system to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_27.name: SC-7(27) Unclassified Non-National Security System Connections
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_27.description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined unclassified non-national security system] to an external network without the use of [Assignment: organization-defined boundary protection device].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_28.name: SC-7(28) Connections To Public Networks
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_28.description: Prohibit the direct connection of [Assignment: organization-defined system] to a public network.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_a.name: SC-7(a)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_a.description: Monitor and control communications at the external managed interfaces to the system and at key internal managed interfaces within the system.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_b.name: SC-7(b)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_b.description: Implement subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are [Selection: physically; logically] separated from internal organizational networks.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_c.name: SC-7(c)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_7_c.description: Connect to external networks or systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security and privacy architecture.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8.name: Transmission Confidentiality And Integrity (SC-8)
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8.description: Protect the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of transmitted information.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_1.name: SC-8(1) Cryptographic Protection
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_1.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] during transmission.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_2.name: SC-8(2) Pre- And Post-Transmission Handling
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_2.description: Maintain the [Selection (one or more): confidentiality; integrity] of information during preparation for transmission and during reception.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_3.name: SC-8(3) Cryptographic Protection For Message Externals
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_3.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to protect message externals unless otherwise protected by [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical controls].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_4.name: SC-8(4) Conceal Or Ramdomize Communications
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_4.description: Implement cryptographic mechanisms to conceal or randomize communication patterns unless otherwise protected by [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical controls].

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_5.name: SC-8(5) Protected Distribution System
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_8_5.description: Implement [Assignment: organization-defined protected distribution system] to [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] during transmission.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_12.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment And Management (SC-12)

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_12_2.name: SC-12(2) Symmetric Keys

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_16_1.name: SC-16(1) Integrity Verification
nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_16_1.description: Verify the integrity of transmitted security and privacy attributes.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_sc_23.name: Session Authenticity (SC-23)

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_si_2_a.description: Identify, report, and correct system flaws.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_si_10_1_c.description: Audit the use of the manual override capability.

nist_800_53_revision_5_gen_001_si_12.description: Manage and retain information within the system and information output from the system in accordance with applicable laws, executive orders, directives, regulations, policies, standards, guidelines and operational requirements.
