ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_am_b_8.description: All default passwords and unnecessary default accounts are changed before system implementation.

ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_1.name: D3.PC.Im.B.1
ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_1.description: Network perimeter defense tools (e.g., border router and firewall) are used.

ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_2.name: D3.PC.Im.B.2
ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_2.description: Systems that are accessed from the Internet or by external parties are protected by firewalls or other similar devices.

ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_5.name: D3.PC.Im.B.5
ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_5.description: Systems configurations (for servers, desktops, routers, etc.) follow industry standards and are enforced

ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_6.name: D3.PC.Im.B.6
ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_6.description: Ports, functions, protocols and services are prohibited if no longer needed for business purposes.

ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_7.name: D3.PC.Im.B.7
ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_im_b_7.description: Access to make changes to systems configurations (including virtual machines and hypervisors) is controlled and monitored.

ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_se_b_1.name: D3.PC.Se.B.1
ffiec_gen_001_d3_pc_se_b_1.description: Developers working for the institution follow secure program coding practices, as part of a system development life cycle (SDLC), that meet industry standards.

ffiec_gen_001_d4_c_co_b_2.name: D4.C.Co.B.2
ffiec_gen_001_d4_c_co_b_2.description: The institution ensures that third-party connections are authorized.

ffiec_gen_001_d5_dr_de_b_1.name: D5.DR.De.B.1
ffiec_gen_001_d5_dr_de_b_1.description: Alert parameters are set for detecting information security incidents that prompt mitigating actions.

ffiec_gen_001_d5_dr_de_b_2.name: D5.DR.De.B.2
ffiec_gen_001_d5_dr_de_b_2.description: System performance reports contain information that can be used as a risk indicator to detect information security incidents.

ffiec_gen_001_d5_dr_de_b_3.name: D5.DR.De.B.3
ffiec_gen_001_d5_dr_de_b_3.description: Tools and processes are in place to detect, alert, and trigger the incident response program.

ffiec_gen_001_d5_er_es_b_4.name: D5.ER.Es.B.4
ffiec_gen_001_d5_er_es_b_4.description: Incidents are classified, logged and tracked.

ffiec_gen_001_d5_ir_pl_b_6.name: D5.IR.Pl.B.6
ffiec_gen_001_d5_ir_pl_b_6.description: The institution plans to use business continuity, disaster recovery, and data backup programs to recover operations following an incident.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.1.name: Policies for information security
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.1.description: Information security policy and topic-specific policies should be defined, approved by management, published, communicated to and acknowledged by relevant personnel and relevant interested parties, and reviewed at planned intervals and if significant changes occur.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.2.name: Roles and Responsibilities
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.2.description: Information security roles and responsibilities should be defined and allocated according to the organisation needs.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.3.name: Segregation of Duties
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.3.description: Conflicting duties and conflicting areas of responsibility should be segregated.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.4.name: Management Responsibilities
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.4.description: Management should require all personnel to apply information security in accordance with the established information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures of the organization.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.5.name: Contact With Authorities
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.5.description: The organisation should establish and maintain contact with relevant authorities.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.6.name: Contact With Special Interest Groups
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.6.description: The organisation should establish and maintain contact with special interest groups or other specialist security forums and professional associations.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.7.name: Threat Intelligence
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.7.description: Information relating to information security threats should be collected and analysed to produce threat intelligence.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.8.name: Information Security In Project Management
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.8.description: Information security should be integrated into project management.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.9.name: Inventory Of Information And Other Associated Assets
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.9.description: An inventory of information and other associated assets, including owners, should be developed and maintained.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.10.name: Acceptable Use Of Information And Other Associated Assets
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.10.description: Rules for the acceptable use and procedures for handling information and other associated assets should be identified, documented and implemented.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.11.name: Return Of Assets
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.11.description: Personnel and other interested parties as appropriate should return all the organisation’s assets in their possession upon change or termination of their employment, contract or agreement.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.12.name: Classification Of Information
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.12.description: Information should be classified according to the information security needs of the organisation based on confidentiality, integrity, availability and relevant interested party requirements.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.13.name: Labelling Of Information
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.13.description: An appropriate set of procedures for information labelling should be developed and implemented in accordance with the information classification scheme adopted by the organisation.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.14.name: Information Transfer
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.14.description: Information transfer rules, procedures, or agreements should be in place for all types of transfer facilities within the organisation and between the organisation and other parties.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.15.name: Access Control
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.15.description: Rules to control physical and logical access to information and other associated assets should be established

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.16.name: Identity Management
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.16.description: The full lifecycle of identities should be managed.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.17.name: Authentication Information
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.17.description: Allocation and management of authentication information should be controlled by a management process, including advising personnel on the appropriate handling of authentication information.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.18.name: Access Rights
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.18.description: Access rights to information and other associated assets should be provisioned, reviewed, modified and removed in accordance with the organisation’s topic-specific policy on and rules for access control.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.19.name: Information Security In Supplier Relationships
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.19.description: Processes and procedures should be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the use of supplier’s products or services.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.20.name: Addressing Information Security Within Supplier Agreements
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.20.description: Relevant information security requirements should be established and agreed with each supplier based on the type of supplier relationship.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.21.name: Managing Information Security In The ICT Supply Chain
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.21.description: Processes and procedures should be defined and implemented to manage the information security risks associated with the ICT products and services supply chain.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.22.name: Monitor, Review And Change Management Of Supplier Services
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.22.description: The organisation should regularly monitor, review, evaluate and manage change in supplier information security practices and service delivery.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.23.name: Information Security For Use Of Cloud Services
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.23.description: Processes for acquisition, use, management and exit from cloud services should be established in accordance with the organisation’s information security requirements.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.24.name: Information Security Incident Management Planning and Preparation
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.24.description: The organization should plan and prepare for managing information security incidents by defining, establishing and communicating information security incident management processes, roles and responsibilities.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.25.name: Assessment And Decision On Information Security Events
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.25.description: The organisation should assess information security events and decide if they are to be categorised as information security incidents.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.26.name: Response To Information Security Incidents
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.26.description: Information security incidents should be responded to in accordance with the documented procedures.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.27.name: Learning From Information Security Incidents
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.27.description: Knowledge gained from information security incidents should be used to strengthen and improve the information security controls.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.28.name: Collection Of Evidence
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.28.description: The organisation should establish and implement procedures for the identification, collection, acquisition and preservation of evidence related to information security events.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.29.name: Information Security During Disruption
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.29.description: The organisation should plan how to maintain information security at an appropriate level during disruption.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.30.name: Readiness For Business Continuity
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.30.description: ICT readiness should be planned, implemented, maintained and tested based on business continuity objectives and ICT continuity requirements.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.31.name: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.31.description: Legal, statutory, regulatory and contractual requirements relevant to information security and the organisations approach to meet these requirements should be identified, documented and kept up to date.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.32.name: Intellectual Property Rights
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.32.description: The organisation should implement appropriate procedures to protect intellectual property rights.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.33.name: Protection Of Records
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.33.description: Records should be protected from loss, destruction, falsification, unauthorised access and unauthorised release.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.34.name: Privacy And Protection Of PII
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.34.description: The organisation should identify and meet the requirements regarding the preservation of privacy and protection of PII according to applicable laws and regulations and contractual requirements.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.35.name: Independent Review Of Information Security
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.35.description: The organisations approach to managing information security and its implementation including people, processes and technologies should be reviewed independently at planned intervals, or when significant changes occur.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.36.name: Compliance With Policies, Rules And Standards For Information Security
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.36.description: Compliance with the organisations information security policy, topic-specific policies, rules and standards should be regularly reviewed.

iso27001_gen_001_A.5.37.name: Documented Operating Procedures
iso27001_gen_001_A.5.37.description: Operating procedures for information processing facilities should be documented and made available to personnel who need them.

iso27001_gen_001_A.6.1.name: Screening
iso27001_gen_001_A.6.1.description: Background verification checks on all candidates to become personnel should be carried out prior to joining the organisation and on an ongoing basis taking into consideration applicable laws, regulations and ethics and be proportional to the business requirements, the classification of the information to be accessed and the perceived risks.

iso27001_gen_001_A.6.2.name: Terms and Conditions Of Employment
iso27001_gen_001_A.6.2.description: The employment contractual agreements should state the personnel’s and the organisations responsibilities for information security.

iso27001_gen_001_A.6.3.name: Information Security Awareness, Education And Training
iso27001_gen_001_A.6.3.description: Personnel of the organisation and relevant interested parties should receive appropriate information security awareness, education and training and regular updates of the organisations information security policy, topic-specific policies and procedures, as relevant for their job function.

iso27001_gen_001_A.6.4.name: Disciplinary Process
iso27001_gen_001_A.6.4.description: A disciplinary process should be formalised and communicated to take actions against personnel and other relevant interested parties who have committed an information security policy violation.

iso27001_gen_001_A.6.5.name: Responsibilities After Termination Or Change Of Employment
iso27001_gen_001_A.6.5.description: Information security responsibilities and duties that remain valid after termination or change of employment should be defined, enforced and communicated to relevant personnel and other interested parties.

iso27001_gen_001_A.6.6.name: Confidentiality Or Non-Disclosure Agreements
iso27001_gen_001_A.6.6.description: Confidentiality or non-disclosure agreements reflecting the organisation’s needs for the protection of information should be identified, documented, regularly reviewed and signed by personnel and other relevant interested parties.

iso27001_gen_001_A.6.7.name: Remote Working
iso27001_gen_001_A.6.7.description: Security measures should be implemented when personnel are working remotely to protect information accessed, processed or stored outside the organisation’s premises.

iso27001_gen_001_A.6.8.name: Information Security Event Reporting
iso27001_gen_001_A.6.8.description: The organisation should provide a mechanism for personnel to report observed or suspected information security events through appropriate channels in a timely manner.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.1.name: Physical Security Perimeters
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.1.description: To prevent unauthorised physical access, damage and interference to the organisations information and other associated assets.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.2.name: Physical Entry
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.2.description: Secure areas should be protected by appropriate entry controls and access points.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.3.name: Securing Offices, Rooms And Facilities
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.3.description: Physical security for offices, rooms and facilities should be designed and implemented.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.4.name: Physical Security Monitoring
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.4.description: Premises should be continuously monitored for unauthorised physical access.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.5.name: Protecting Against Physical and Environmental Threats
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.5.description: Protection against physical and environmental threats, such as natural disasters and other intentional or unintentional physical threats to infrastructure should be designed and implemented.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.6.name: Working In Secure Areas
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.6.description: Security measures for working in secure areas should be designed and implemented.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.7.name: Clear Desk And Clear Screen
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.7.description: Clear desk rules for papers and removable storage media and clear screen rules for information processing facilities should be defined and appropriately enforced.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.8.name: Equipment Siting And Protection
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.8.description: Equipment should be sited securely and protected.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.10.name: Storage Media
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.10.description: Storage media should be managed through their life cycle of acquisition, use, transportation and disposal in accordance with the organisations classification scheme and handling requirements.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.11.name: Supporting Utilities
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.11.description: Information processing facilities should be protected from power failures and other disruptions caused by failures in supporting utilities.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.12.name: Cabling Security
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.12.description: Cables carrying power, data or supporting information services should be protected from interception

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.13.name: Equipment Maintenance
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.13.description: Equipment should be maintained correctly to ensure availability, integrity and confidentiality of information.

iso27001_gen_001_A.7.14.name: Secure Disposal Or Re-Use Of Equipment
iso27001_gen_001_A.7.14.description: Items of equipment containing storage media should be verified to ensure that any sensitive data and licensed software has been removed or securely overwritten prior to disposal or re-use.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.1.name: User Endpoint Devices
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.1.description: Information stored on, processed by or accessible via user endpoint devices should be protected.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.2.name: Privileged Access Rights
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.2.description: The allocation and use of privileged access rights should be restricted and managed.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.3.name: Information Access Restriction
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.3.description: Access to information and other associated assets should be restricted in accordance with the established topic-specific policy on access control.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.4.name: Access To Source Code
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.4.description: Read and write access to source code, development tools and software libraries should be appropriately managed.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.5.name: Secure Authentication
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.5.description: Secure authentication technologies and procedures should be implemented based on information access restrictions and the topic-specific policy on access control.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.6.name: Capacity Management
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.6.description: The use of resources should be monitored and adjusted in line with current and expected capacity requirements.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.7.name: Protection Against Malware
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.7.description: Protection against malware should be implemented and supported by appropriate user awareness.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.8.name: Management of Technical Vulnerabilities
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.8.description: Information about technical vulnerabilities of information systems in use should be obtained, the organisations exposure to such vulnerabilities should be evaluated and appropriate measures should be taken.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.9.name: Configuration Management
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.9.description: Configurations, including security configurations, of hardware, software, services and networks should be established, documented, implemented, monitored and reviewed.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.10.name: Information Deletion
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.10.description: Information stored in information systems, devices or in any other storage media should be deleted when no longer required.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.11.name: Data Masking
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.11.description: Data masking should be used in accordance with the organisation’s topic-specific policy on access control and other related topic-specific policies, and business requirements, taking applicable legislation into consideration.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.12.name: Data Leakage Prevention
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.12.description: Data leakage prevention measures should be applied to systems, networks and any other devices that process, store or transmit sensitive information.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.13.name: Information Backup
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.13.description: Backup copies of information, software and systems should be maintained and regularly tested in accordance with the agreed topic-specific policy on backup.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.14.name: Redundancy of information processing facilities
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.14.description: Information processing facilities should be implemented with redundancy sufficient to meet availability

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.15.name: Logging
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.15.description: Logs that record activities, exceptions, faults and other relevant events should be produced, stored, protected and analysed.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.16.name: Monitoring Activities
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.16.description: Networks, systems and applications should be monitored for anomalous behaviour and appropriate actions taken to evaluate potential information security incidents.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.17.name: Clock Synchronisation
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.17.description: The clocks of information processing systems used by the organisation should be synchronised to approved time sources.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.18.name: Use of Privileged Utility Programs
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.18.description: The use of utility programs that can be capable of overriding system and application controls should be restricted and tightly controlled

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.19.name: Installation of Software on Operational Systems
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.19.description: Procedures and measures should be implemented to securely manage software installation on operational systems.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.20.name: Network Security
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.20.description: Networks and network devices should be secured, managed and controlled to protect information in systems and applications.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.21.name: Security of Network Services
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.21.description: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services should be identified, implemented and monitored.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.22.name: Segregation of Networks
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.22.description: Security mechanisms, service levels and service requirements of network services should be identified, implemented and monitored.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.23.name: Web Filtering
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.23.description: Access to external websites should be managed to reduce exposure to malicious content.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.24.name: Use of Cryptography
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.24.description: Rules for the effective use of cryptography, including cryptographic key management, should be defined and implemented.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.25.name: Secure Development Life Cycle
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.25.description: Rules for the secure development of software and systems should be established and applied.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.26.name: Application Security Requirements
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.26.description: Information security requirements should be identified, specified and approved when developing or acquiring applications.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.27.name: Secure Systems Architecture and Engineering Principles
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.27.description: Principles for engineering secure systems should be established, documented, maintained and applied to any information system development activities.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.29.name: Security Testing in Development and Acceptance
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.29.description: Security testing processes should be defined and implemented in the development life cycle.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.30.name: Outsourced Development
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.30.description: The organisation should direct, monitor and review the activities related to outsourced system development.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.31.name: Separation of Development, Test and Production Environments
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.31.description: Development, testing and production environments should be separated and secured.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.32.name: Change Management
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.32.description: Changes to information processing facilities and information systems should be subject to change management procedures.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.33.name: Test Information
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.33.description: Test information should be appropriately selected, protected and managed.

iso27001_gen_001_A.8.34.name: Protection of Information Systems During Audit Testing
iso27001_gen_001_A.8.34.description: Audit tests and other assurance activities involving assessment of operational systems should be planned and agreed between the tester and appropriate management.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: AC-2(1) Automated System Account Management
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: The organization employs automated mechanisms to support the management of information system accounts.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: AC-2(4) Automated Audit Actions
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: The information system automatically audits account creation, modification, enabling, disabling, and removal actions, and notifies [Assignment: organization-defined personnel or roles].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: AC-2(12)(a)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: The organization: a. Monitors information system accounts for [Assignment: organization-defined atypical use].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: AC-2(f)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: The organization: f. Creates, enables, modifies, disables, and removes information system accounts in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined procedures or conditions].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: AC-2(g)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: The organization: g. Monitors the use of information system accounts.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: AC-2(j)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: The organization: j. Reviews accounts for compliance with account management requirements [Assignment: organization-defined frequency].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: AC-2-3
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: The information system automatically disables inactive accounts after 90 days for user accounts.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_3.name: Access Enforcement (AC-3)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_3.description: The information system enforces approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_4.name: Information Flow Enforcement (AC-4)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_4.description: The information system enforces approved authorizations for controlling the flow of information within the system and between interconnected systems based on organization-defined information flow control policies.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_5.name: AC-5(c)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_5.description: The organization: c. Defines information system access authorizations to support separation of duties.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_6.name: AC-6(10) Prohibit Non-Privileged Users From Executing Privileged Functions
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_6.description: The information system prevents non-privileged users from executing privileged functions to include disabling, circumventing, or altering implemented security safeguards/countermeasures.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_6.name: Least Privilege (AC-6)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_6.description: The organization employs the principle of least privilege, allowing only authorized accesses for users (or processes acting on behalf of users) which are necessary to accomplish assigned tasks in accordance with organizational missions and business functions.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_1.name: AC-17(1) Automated Monitoring/Control
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_1.description: The information system monitors and controls remote access methods.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_1.name: AC-17(2) Protection Of Confidentiality/Integrity Using Encryption
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_1.description: The information system implements cryptographic mechanisms to protect the confidentiality and integrity of remote access sessions.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: AC-21(b)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: The organization: b. Employs [Assignment: organization-defined automated mechanisms or manual processes] to assist users in making information sharing/collaboration decisions.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_2.name: AU-2(a)(d)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_2.description: The organization: a. Determines that the information system is capable of auditing the following events: Successful and unsuccessful account logon events, account management events, object access, policy change, privilege functions, process tracking, and system events. For Web applications: all administrator activity, authentication checks, authorization checks, data deletions, data access, data changes, and permission changes. d. Determines that the following events are to be audited within the information system: [organization-defined subset of the auditable events defined in AU-2 a to be audited continually for each identified event].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_3.name: Content of Audit Records (AU-3)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_3.description: The information system generates audit records containing information that establishes what type of event occurred, when the event occurred, where the event occurred, the source of the event, the outcome of the event, and the identity of any individuals or subjects associated with the event.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_6.name: AU-6(1)(3)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_6.description: (1) The organization employs automated mechanisms to integrate audit review, analysis, and reporting processes to support organizational processes for investigation and response to suspicious activities. (3) The organization analyzes and correlates audit records across different repositories to gain organization-wide situational awareness.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_7.name: AU-7(1) Automatic Processing
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_7.description: The information system provides the capability to process audit records for events of interest based on [Assignment: organization-defined audit fields within audit records].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_9.name: AU-9(2) Audit Backup On Separate Physical Systems / Components
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_9.description: The information system backs up audit records at least weekly onto a physically different system or system component than the system or component being audited.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_9.name: Protection of Audit Information (AU-9)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_9.description: The information system protects audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_1.name: Audit Record Retention (AU-11)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_1.description: The organization retains audit records for at least 90 days to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_1.name: AU-12(a)(c)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_au_1.description: The information system: a. Provides audit record generation capability for the auditable events defined in AU-2 a. at all information system and network components where audit capability is deployed/available c. Generates audit records for the events defined in AU-2 d. with the content defined in AU-3.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ca_7.name: CA-7(a)(b)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ca_7.description: The organization develops a continuous monitoring strategy and implements a continuous monitoring program that includes: a. Establishment of [Assignment: organization-defined metrics] to be monitored; b. Establishment of [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for monitoring and [Assignment: organization-defined frequencies] for assessments supporting such monitoring.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cm_2.name: Baseline Configuration (CM-2)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cm_2.description: The organization develops, documents, and maintains under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the information system.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cm_7.name: CM-7(a)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cm_7.description: The organization: a. Configures the information system to provide only essential capabilities.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cm_8.name: CM-8(1)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cm_8.description: The organization updates the inventory of information system components as an integral part of component installations, removals, and information system updates.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cm_8.name: CM-8(3)(a)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cm_8.description: The organization: a. Employs automated mechanisms continuously, using automated mechanisms with a maximum five-minute delay in detection, to detect the presence of unauthorized hardware, software, and firmware components within the information system

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cp_9.name: CP-9(b))
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cp_9.description: The organization: b. Conducts backups of system-level information contained in the information system (daily incremental; weekly full).

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cp_1.name: Information System Recovery And Reconstitution (CP-10)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_cp_1.description: The organization provides for the recovery and reconstitution of the information system to a known state after a disruption, compromise, or failure.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_2.name: IA-2(1)(2)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_2.description: (1) The information system implements multifactor authentication for network access to privileged accounts. (2) The information system implements multifactor authentication for network access to non- privileged accounts.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_2.name: IA-2(1) Network Access To Privileged Accounts
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_2.description: The information system implements multi-factor authentication for network access to privileged accounts.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_2.name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational users) (IA-2)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_2.description: The information system uniquely identifies and authenticates organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of organizational users).

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_5.name: IA-5(1)(a)(d)(e)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_5.description: The information system, for password-based authentication: a. Enforces minimum password complexity of [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for case sensitivity, number of characters, mix of upper-case letters, lower-case letters, numbers, and special characters, including minimum requirements for each type]; d. Enforces password minimum and maximum lifetime restrictions of [Assignment: organization- defined numbers for lifetime minimum, lifetime maximum]; e. Prohibits password reuse for 24 generations

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_5.name: IA-5(4) Automated Support For Password Strength Determination
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_5.description: The organization employs automated tools to determine if password authenticators are sufficiently strong to satisfy [Assignment: organization-defined requirements].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_5.name: IA-5(7) No Embedded Unencrypted Static Authenticators
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ia_5.description: The organization ensures that unencrypted static authenticators are not embedded in applications or access scripts or stored on function keys.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ir_4.name: IR-4(1) Automated Incident Handling Processes
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ir_4.description: The organization employs automated mechanisms to support the incident handling process.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ir_6.name: IR-6(1) Automated Reporting
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ir_6.description: The organization employs automated mechanisms to assist in the reporting of security incidents.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ir_7.name: IR-7(1) Automation Support For Availability Of Information / Support
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ir_7.description: The organization employs automated mechanisms to increase the availability of incident response-related information and support.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ra_5.name: Vulnerability Scanning (RA-5)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_ra_5.description: Scan for system vulnerabilities. Share vulnerability information and security controls that eliminate vulnerabilities.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sa_3.name: SA-3(a)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sa_3.description: The organization: a. Manages the information system using [Assignment: organization-defined system development life cycle] that incorporates information security considerations.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sa_1.name: Developer Configuration Management (SA-10)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sa_1.description: The organization requires the developer of the information system, system component, or information system service to: a. Perform configuration management during system, component, or service [Selection (one or more): design; development; implementation; operation]; b. Document, manage, and control the integrity of changes to [Assignment: organization-defined configuration items under configuration management]; c. Implement only organization-approved changes to the system, component, or service; d. Document approved changes to the system, component, or service and the potential security impacts of such changes; and e. Track security flaws and flaw resolution within the system, component, or service and report findings to [Assignment: organization-defined personnel].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_2.name: Application Partitioning (SC-2)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_2.description: The information system separates user functionality (including user interface services) from information system management functionality.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_4.name: Information In Shared Resources (SC-4)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_4.description: The information system prevents unauthorized and unintended information transfer via shared system resources.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_5.name: Denial Of Service Protection (SC-5)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_5.description: The information system protects against or limits the effects of the following types of denial of service attacks: [Assignment: organization-defined types of denial of service attacks or references to sources for such information] by employing [Assignment: organization-defined security safeguards].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7.name: SC-7(3) Access Points
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7.description: The organization limits the number of external network connections to the information system.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7.name: Boundary Protection (SC-7)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7.description: The information system: a. Monitors and controls communications at the external boundary of the system and at key internal boundaries within the system; b. Implements subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are [Selection: physically; logically] separated from internal organizational networks; and c. Connects to external networks or information systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_8.name: SC-8(1) Cryptographic Or Alternate Physical Protection
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_8.description: The information system implements cryptographic mechanisms to [Selection (one or more): prevent unauthorized disclosure of information; detect changes to information] during transmission unless otherwise protected by [Assignment: organization-defined alternative physical safeguards].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_8.name: Transmission Integrity (SC-8)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_8.description: The information system protects the confidentiality AND integrity of transmitted information.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_1.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment And Management (SC-12)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_1.description: The organization establishes and manages cryptographic keys for required cryptography employed within the information system in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_1.name: Use of Cryptography (SC-13)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_1.description: The information system implements FIPS-validated or NSA-approved cryptography in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_2.name: Session Authenticity (SC-23)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_2.description: The information system protects the authenticity of communications sessions.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_2.name: Protection of Information at Rest (SC-28)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_sc_2.description: The information system protects the confidentiality AND integrity of [Assignment: organization-defined information at rest].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_2.name: Automated Flaw Remediation Status (SI-2(2))
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_2.description: The organization employs automated mechanisms at least monthly to determine the state of information system components with regard to flaw remediation.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.name: SI-4(1) System-Wide Intrusion Detection System
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.description: The organization connects and configures individual intrusion detection tools into an information system-wide intrusion detection system.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.name: SI-4(16) Correlate Monitoring Information
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.description: The organization correlates information from monitoring tools employed throughout the information system.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.name: SI-4(2) Automated Tools For Real-Time Analysis
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.description: The organization employs automated tools to support near real-time analysis of events.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.name: SI-4(4) Inbound and Outbound Communications Traffic
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.description: The information system monitors inbound and outbound communications traffic continuously for unusual or unauthorized activities or conditions.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.name: SI-4(5) System-Generated Alerts
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.description: The information system alerts organization-defined personnel or roles when the following indications of compromise or potential compromise occur: [Assignment: organization-defined compromise indicators].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.name: SI-4(a)(b)(c)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_4.description: The organization: a. Monitors the information system to detect: 1. Attacks and indicators of potential attacks in accordance with [Assignment: organization- defined monitoring objectives]; and 2. Unauthorized local, network, and remote connections; b. Identifies unauthorized use of the information system through [Assignment: organization- defined techniques and methods]; c. Deploys monitoring devices: i. strategically within the information system to collect organization-determined essential information; and (ii) at ad hoc locations within the system to track specific types of transactions of interest to the organization.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_7.name: SI-7(1) Integrity Checks
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_7.description: The information system performs an integrity check of security relevant events at least monthly.

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_7.name: Software, Firmware, and Information Integrity (SI-7)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_7.description: The organization employs integrity verification tools to detect unauthorized changes to [Assignment: organization-defined software, firmware, and information].

fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_1.name: Information Handling and Retention (SI-12)
fedramp_moderate_revision_4_gen_001_si_1.description: The organization handles and retains information within the information system and information output from the system in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, standards, and operational requirements.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.name: Account Management (AC-2)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ac_2.description: Manage system accounts, group memberships, privileges, workflow, notifications, deactivations, and authorizations.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ac_3.name: Account Management (AC-3)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ac_3.description: The information system enforces approved authorizations for logical access to information and system resources in accordance with applicable access control policies.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ac_17.name: Remote Access (AC-17)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ac_17.description: Authorize remote access systems prior to connection. Enforce remote connection requirements to information systems.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_au_2.name: Audit Events (AU-2)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_au_2.description: The organization: a. Determines that the information system is capable of auditing the following events: [Assignment: organization-defined auditable events]; b. Coordinates the security audit function with other organizational entities requiring audit- related information to enhance mutual support and to help guide the selection of auditable events; c. Provides a rationale for why the auditable events are deemed to be adequate support after- the-fact investigations of security incidents

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_au_9.name: Protection of Audit Information (AU-9)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_au_9.description: The information system protects audit information and audit tools from unauthorized access, modification, and deletion.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_au_11.name: Audit Record Retention (AU-11)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_au_11.description: The organization retains audit records for at least 90 days to provide support for after-the-fact investigations of security incidents and to meet regulatory and organizational information retention requirements.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ca_7.name: Continuous Monitoring (CA-7)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ca_7.description: Continuously monitor configuration management processes. Determine security impact, environment and operational risks.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_cm_2.name: Baseline Configuration (CM-2)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_cm_2.description: The organization develops, documents, and maintains under configuration control, a current baseline configuration of the information system.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_cm_8.name: Information System Component Inventory (CM-8)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_cm_8.description: The organization develops and documents an inventory of information system components that accurately reflects the current information system, includes all components within the authorization boundary of the information system, is at the level of granularity deemed necessary for tracking and reporting and reviews and updates the information system component inventory.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_cp_9.name: Information System Backup (CP-9)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_cp_9.description: The organization conducts backups of user-level information, system-level information and information system documentation including security-related documentation contained in the information system and protects the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of backup information at storage locations.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_cp_10.name: Information System Recovery And Reconstitution (CP-10)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_cp_10.description: The organization provides for the recovery and reconstitution of the information system to a known state after a disruption, compromise, or failure.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ia_2.name: Identification and Authentication (Organizational users) (IA-2)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ia_2.description: The information system uniquely identifies and authenticates organizational users (or processes acting on behalf of organizational users).

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ir_4.name: Incident Handling (IR-4)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_ir_4.description: The organization implements an incident handling capability for security incidents that includes preparation, detection and analysis, containment, eradication, and recovery, coordinates incident handling activities with contingency planning activities and incorporates lessons learned from ongoing incident handling activities into incident response procedures, training, and testing, and implements the resulting changes accordingly.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sa_3.name: System Development Life Cycle (SA-3)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sa_3.description: The organization manages the information system using organization-defined system development life cycle, defines and documents information security roles and responsibilities throughout the system development life cycle, identifies individuals having information security roles and responsibilities and integrates the organizational information security risk management process into system development life cycle activities.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sc_5.name: Denial Of Service Protection (SC-5)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sc_5.description: The information system protects against or limits the effects of the following types of denial of service attacks: [Assignment: organization-defined types of denial of service attacks or references to sources for such information] by employing [Assignment: organization-defined security safeguards].

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7.name: Boundary Protection (SC-7)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sc_7.description: The information system: a. Monitors and controls communications at the external boundary of the system and at key internal boundaries within the system; b. Implements subnetworks for publicly accessible system components that are [Selection: physically; logically] separated from internal organizational networks; and c. Connects to external networks or information systems only through managed interfaces consisting of boundary protection devices arranged in accordance with an organizational security architecture.

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sc_12.name: Cryptographic Key Establishment And Management (SC-12)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sc_12.description: The organization establishes and manages cryptographic keys for required cryptography employed within the information system in accordance with [Assignment: organization-defined requirements for key generation, distribution, storage, access, and destruction].

fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sc_13.name: Use of Cryptography (SC-13)
fedramp_low_revision_4_gen_001_sc_13.description: The information system implements FIPS-validated or NSA-approved cryptography in accordance with applicable federal laws, Executive Orders, directives, policies, regulations, and standards.
